com.thedemgel.regions.component

Class WorldRegionComponent

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.spout.api.component.Component
      • org.spout.api.component.world.WorldComponent
        • com.thedemgel.regions.component.WorldRegionComponent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.spout.api.tickable.Tickable

    public class WorldRegionComponent
extends org.spout.api.component.world.WorldComponent
    WorldRegionComponent is where all the regions are stored, and 99% of all Regions are accessed and modified. Should be called with world.getComponentHolder().get(WorldRegionComponent.class) there should be no need to access a region directly, if something is missing and you find you need to access a region, feature, or feature parent directly, please notify me and I will fix it.
    Author:
    tenowg

    • Method Detail

      • addRegion

        public void addRegion(Region region)
        Will add an already created Region to the Maps and parse its PointMaps and effectively add the region to the Map. (Should only be called from createRegion, or if the Region Object has been FULLY created first)
        Parameters:
        region -

      • removeRegion

        public void removeRegion(Region region)
        Will completely remove a region from all Maps effectively removing it from the game.
        Parameters:
        region - Region to be removed

      • updateRegion

        public Region updateRegion(Region region)
        Should be called after the size of a Region has been changed. This will "fix" the PointMaps and regenerate the PointMap cache of the region.
        Parameters:
        region - Region after it has been updated with new Coords.

      • getRegion

        public Region getRegion(String name)
        Gets a region by name. Not the preferred method of retrieving a region. As names can change, and more processor is needed.
        Parameters:
        name -
        Returns:
        Region whose name is name

      • getRegion

        public Region getRegion(UUID uuid)
        Gets a region by UUID. Developers should store UUIDs instead of Names in their plugins As they should never change once the regions are created, and use less time to search.
        Parameters:
        uuid - UUID of the region being searched.
        Returns:
        Region whose UUID is uuid

      • getRegion

        public Set<Region> getRegion(org.spout.api.entity.Player player)
        Gets a regions a Player is in.
        Parameters:
        player - The player to check
        Returns:
        Regions the player is currently in

      • createRegion

        public Region createRegion(org.spout.api.entity.Player player,
                  String name)
        Creates a Region from SelectPlayer selections.
        Parameters:
        player - The player creating the Region.
        name - Name of the Region
        Returns:
        The Created Region

      • getRegion

        public Set<Region> getRegion(org.spout.api.geo.discrete.Point point)
        Will return the Regions that contains a specific point. The return is unmodifiable.
        Parameters:
        point -
        Returns:
        Unmodifiable Set of Regions that contain the point

        Returns:

      • execute

        public void execute(org.spout.api.event.Event event,
           org.spout.api.geo.discrete.Point point)
        Method to call Features from a Point in a Region. Use to call feature execute from other directly. It is possible to send NULL events.
        Parameters:
        event -
        point -

      • execute

        public void execute(org.spout.api.event.Event event,
           String regionName)
        Method to call Features from Region Name Use to call feature execute from other directly. It is possible to send NULL events. (Not recommended)
        Parameters:
        event - Event to be called
        regionName - Name of the region

      • execute

        public void execute(org.spout.api.event.Event event,
           UUID uuid)
        Method to call Features from a Region's UUID Use to call feature execute from other directly. It is possible to send NULL events. (Preferred method)
        Parameters:
        event - Event to be called
        uuid - UUID of the Region

      • execute

        public void execute(org.spout.api.event.Event event,
           Region region)
        Method to call Features from a Region with Region OBJECT. Use to call feature execute from other directly. It is possible to send NULL events. (Fastest way if you have the region object)
        Parameters:
        event - Event to be called
        region - The Region OBJECT
